result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Arraignment on August 31, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

9:29 AM Defendant Jeramie J Mason in court, in custody.  Attorney Anthony C. Delyea in court for Jeramie J Mason.  Prosecuting attorney Annie Jay in court for the State of Wisconsin. Law Enforcement officer Morgan Youngquist duly sworn & testified; Venue Established; Witness ID'd defn; State moves for bindover - waives argument, reserves for rebuttal; Defense objects to bindover - waives argument; Ct binds case over; bail continued. TRIAL BRANCH TO SCHEDULE ARRAIGNMENT. COURT ORDERED THAT DEFENDANT BE HELD IN THE DANE COUNTY JAIL UNTIL NEXT PROCEEDING.

9:54 AM Prosecuting attorney Hector Al-Homsi in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jeramie J Mason in court, in custody. Attorney Anthony Delyea did not appear. Attorney Delyea submitted a letter on 8/11/2022 indicating he would be late to hearing. State stated that a subsequent email was received by their office indicating that Attorney Delyea would not be available for this hearing. Court found good cause for a set over and rescheduled Preliminary Hearing. COURT ORDERED THAT DEFENDANT BE HELD IN THE DANE COUNTY JAIL UNTIL AFTER THE 8/19/2022 PRELIMINARY HEARING.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.

09:08 AM Attorney Anthony C. Delyea in court on behalf of defendant.  Valerian Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense indicated that defendant in custody in Milwaukee House of Corrections. Defense moved to dismiss case, argued that Preliminary Hearing could not be heard within time limits due to unavailability of defendant. Objection and argument by State. Court found good cause to extend time limits.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.
